verses.verse: (For the choir director; with stringed instruments, upon an eight-stringed lyre.) (A Psalm of David.) O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> do not <S%H3198>rebuke<s%> me in Thine <S%H639>anger,<s%> <S%H408>Nor<s%> <S%H3256>chasten<s%> me in Thy <S%H2534>wrath.<s%>
Be <S%H2603>gracious<s%> to me, O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> for I [am] <S%H536>pining<s%> <S%H536>away;<s%> <S%H7495>Heal<s%> me, O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> for my <S%H6106>bones<s%> are <S%H926>dismayed.<s%>
And my <S%H5315>soul<s%> is <S%H3966>greatly<s%> <S%H926>dismayed;<s%> But Thou, O <S%H3068>Lord<s%> â€“ <S%H4970>how<s%> <S%H5704>long<s%> <S%H4970><s%>?
For <S%H369>there<s%> is <S%H369>no<s%> <S%H2143>mention<s%> of Thee in <S%H4194>death;<s%> In <S%H7585>Sheol<s%> <S%H4310>who<s%> will <S%H3034>give<s%> Thee <S%H3034>thanks<s%>?

I am <S%H3021>weary<s%> with my <S%H585>sighing;<s%> <S%H3605>Every<s%> <S%H3915>night<s%> I make my <S%H4296>bed<s%> <S%H7811>swim,<s%> I <S%H4529>dissolve<s%> my <S%H6210>couch<s%> with my <S%H1832>tears.<s%>
My <S%H5869>eye<s%> has <S%H6244>wasted<s%> <S%H6244>away<s%> with <S%H3708>grief;<s%> It has <S%H6275>become<s%> <S%H6275>old<s%> because of <S%H3605>all<s%> my <S%H6887>adversaries.<s%>
<S%H5493>Depart<s%> from me, <S%H3605>all<s%> you who <S%H6466>do<s%> <S%H205>iniquity,<s%> For the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> has <S%H8085>heard<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H1065>weeping.<s%>

<S%H3605>All<s%> my <S%H340>enemies<s%> shall be <S%H954>ashamed<s%> and <S%H3966>greatly<s%> <S%H926>dismayed;<s%> They shall <S%H7725>turn<s%> <S%H7725>back,<s%> they shall <S%H7281>suddenly<s%> be <S%H954>ashamed.<s%>
